message.entry: Add the following code to the beginning of {0}.
You must configure this property programmatically in App Designer.
Set this property at the beginning of the {0}.
Using findobj, findall or gcbo to locate a UIControl object requires updates to your code.
Access your app component using the handles structure instead, or update your code to use the associated App Designer component. For more details, see GUIDE Migration Strategies.
Use of nargin or narginchk might result in an error or unexpected behavior because the app input argument has been added to each helper function.
Update your nargin or narginchk code to account for the extra input argument.
Determine if this functionality is critical to your app before continuing because there is no workaround.
Invalid parent for radio button. Set the parent to a button group.
Recreate the radio button in a button group in App Designer. Alternatively, consider replacing the radio button with a state button or a check box.
App Designer only supports pixel units. You might need to update the SizeChangedFcn callback if it uses other units.

Consider using automatic resizing or a grid layout manager instead. Alternatively, update your SizeChangedFcn callback to work with pixel units. To learn about resizing App Designer apps, see Managing Resizable Apps in App Designer.
If the callback code can be executed after all the app components have been created, then move that code to the {0}.
There is no equivalent OutputFcn functionality in App Designer.

If your OutputFcn function includes initialization code that is critical to your app, then add it to the end of {0} instead. If your OutputFcn function specifies output to be assigned to the workspace when you instantiate the app, see GUIDE Migration Strategies.
You must configure this callback programmatically in App Designer because it uses more than the default number of arguments.

At the beginning of {0}, specify the callback as a cell array. Specify the first element of the cell array as a function handle to a private helper function. Specify additional elements for each additional input argument. To learn about assigning callbacks programmatically, see Add UI Components to App Designer Programmatically.
You must configure this callback programmatically in App Designer because it executes a function that is not defined in the app code file.
You must configure this callback programmatically in App Designer because it contains commands that are evaluated in the base workspace.
Callbacks for radio and toggle buttons must be added to a parent button group.
Use the SelectionChangedFcn callback of the parent button group.
This callback property for the component(s) is not supported in App Designer and was not migrated.
The default ClickedCallback for the predefined save tool is not supported in App Designer and was not migrated.
This component is not supported in App Designer and was not migrated.
The CData property is not intended for check boxes and radio buttons.
To display an image, replace the component with a uiimage from the App Designer Component Library.
This property has been replaced with a scroll function on the component.
This property for the component(s) is not supported in App Designer and was not migrated.
Using the uicontrol function to dynamically add a UIControl object to your app is not supported in App Designer.
Update your code to use the associated App Designer component. For more details, see GUIDE Migration Strategies.
This function is not supported in App Designer code.
The reset input argument to the clf function is not supported in App Designer code.
Using this function requires additional code in your app.
Call the axes, polaraxes, or geoaxes function to create the axes first. Create the desired plot, and then call the {0} function.
Calling a callback programmatically from another function or callback is not recommended and will error in a migrated app.
In your migrated app, move the callback code to a separate app helper function and then call this helper function instead.
This functionality is not recommended and will be removed in a future release.
See Recommendations for MATLAB Apps Using Java and ActiveX for potential alternatives.
